page.title: 01BRADWELL,STISTED,PATTISWICK
page.content: {*}The survey area consists of open countryside characteristic of the region,with widely-scattered small villages and hamlets.The main areas of settlement are the villages of{ {Bradwell,Stisted}and{Pattiswick},all close to a Roman road(Stane Street) leading to Colchester. {*}Arable farming predominates,based on a combination of heavy soils and low rainfall.The area is part of the gently undulating North Essex and West Suffolk plateau and is dissected by the major valley of the River Blackwater.The river drains in a generally east to south-easterly direction,reflecting the slope of the plateau. {*}The area has large deposits of Kesgrave Sands and Gravels,the basis of a small extraction industry centred on Bradwell Pit.
